column9: When considering taking Accutane, do some serious research on what you are getting yourself into. I completed my 5 month treatment a few weeks ago and my acne is completely gone. I struggled with acne for 10 years, trying everything on the market, and yielding zero improvement. The medicine started working right away, and I experienced a clear face for the first time in 10 years, in that I had no acne and I had a lack of oil on my face (I had very oily skin). These were great and all, but the side effects were quite more abundant. I had the obvious dry skin and dry cracked lips, my eyes were constantly bloodshot and glassy (people constantly mistook this for me being high), I developed a painful stye at one point, my upper lip and eye brows would constantly sweat reaI bad (very strange), I developed these circular sores on my arms that have left their mark still months later, my skin would split and cut very easily, the skin on my face was always red, my nails peeled and chipped away, and I developed allergies (never had them before, and its possible that they aren't from the medicine, but I find it strange that they randomly developed about a month after starting the medicines). Currently, (3 weeks post treatment) my skin is still clear and soft, which is absolutely wonderful, the oil in my skin has come back, but not to its full extent, and I can go in the sun again, which is a blessing. Yesterday though, I woke up and my eye was in pain an swollen almost shut. I went to the walk in clinic and he couldn't figure out what was wrong. I have heard of other people having eye problems post Accutane, so I think that is the culprit. This eye problem is a pain in the butt though and I don't know when it will get better/if it will be a reoccuring problem for the rest of my life. At this point, I don't regret using Accutane since it has boosted my confidence monumentally, but I feel as time goes on and I continue to experience permanent side effects, that I may regret it.

column9: This drug is effective at treating acne. No Question. Its amazing at acomplishing these ends. Period. That being said, Accutane is all about trade offs. You will have side effects. You well almost certainly have: extreme dry / fraglie skin, wickedly dry / cracked lips. This I can almost promise. Other side effects that I personally believe are attributable to my using Accutane: several ingrown toe nails, watery itchy eyes, mild nose bleeds, itchy scalp and hair shedding, muscle ache thus decresed athletic capability. Keep in mind that you may have to take more than one round of Accutane to reach the desired results. I took two, close together. I believe the benefits and side effects compound with each successive round.The bottom line. It works. I've been ance free for years since completing treatment (though my acne was not nearly as severe as most on Accutane). The side effects have also lasted to some extent. Many years later, I still have far more frigile / dry skin compared to before treatment. Scalp itch, hair loss, and very dry itchy eyes has continued. My advice... very carefully weigh the costs and benefits before treatment. There will be side effects, some will potentially be unpredicable and / or undocumented. Pay close attention to your body during treatment and communicate clearly with your doc about side effects / complications. Don't be blinded by the positives of clear skin, if the rest of your body is being subjected to huge stress / side effects. Keep in mind that some of these side effects may last and docs may not be able to do anything about it. Also, I've heard that Accutane is still effective, but with fewer side effects, if taken at a lower dose over a longer period of time (but same total dose over the course of the treatment). If concerned about side effects, you may want to ask your doc if this is true. Good luck!
